name: Spearmint
tagline: An extended Quake III Arena engine for creating standalone games.
body:
The intent of this project is to provide a version of ioquake3 which may be used for further development of standalone games.

Some of the major features currently implemented are:

  * Four player splitscreen, offline and in network games
  * Extended API for game, cgame, and ui, includes some of the new features added in RTCW, WolfET, Turtle Arena, Tremulous, and World of Padman
  * Capsule collision support, enabled for players by default
  * Modified pure pk3 system, see [PAKSUMS](http://github.com/zturtleman/spearmint/wiki/PAKSUMS) wiki page
  * Improved game, cgame, and ui API version handling
  * Removed code not needed for standalone games (CD Key handling, authentication server code, and punkbuster ui code)
  * Ogg Opus and Ogg Vorbis support enabled by default, source and headers included in local source tree for easy compiling
  * FreeType support enabled by default, source and headers included in local source tree for easy compiling

Read more at the [Spearmint wiki](http://github.com/zturtleman/spearmint/wiki).

## Running Quake III Arena using Spearmint
* Get the source and compile it using make. The game will be in `build/release-YOURPLATFORM-YOURARCH/`.
* Copy your Quake III Arena pak[0-8].pk3 into `build/release-YOURPLATFORM-YOURARCH/baseq3`. (Don't own Q3? Buy it on [Steam](http://store.steampowered.com/sub/433/).)
* Create a textfile named `build/release-YOURPLATFORM-YOURARCH/baseq3/PAKSUMS`, put baseq3 text from [PAKSUMS](http://github.com/zturtleman/spearmint/wiki/PAKSUMS) in the file.
* Run `build/release-YOURPLATFORM-YOURARCH/spearmint.YOURARCH`

You can add splitscreen players using the in-game menu after you start or join a server.

### Running Quake III: Team Arena using Spearmint
* Follow the steps for Quake III Arena above.
* Copy your Quake III: Team Arena pak[0-3].pk3 into `build/release-YOURPLATFORM-YOURARCH/missionpack`. (Don't own Team Arena? Buy it on [Steam](http://store.steampowered.com/sub/433/).)
* Create a textfile named `build/release-YOURPLATFORM-YOURARCH/missionpack/PAKSUMS`, put missionpack text from [PAKSUMS](http://github.com/zturtleman/spearmint/wiki/PAKSUMS) in the file.
* Run `build/release-YOURPLATFORM-YOURARCH/spearmint.YOURARCH` and choose Team Arena from the menu.
